body_html:
Yes, my path is empty (I thought that is the purpose of "env -"). Python is installed into /usr/bin/python. Never the less, I don't want to build with my systems default python binary, but with the one inside my virtualenv. This is not possible, if the environment is cleared before (with env -).

Why is it even cleared?
body_text:
Yes, my path is empty (I thought that is the purpose of "env -"). Python is installed into /usr/bin/python. Never the less, I don't want to build with my systems default python binary, but with the one inside my virtualenv. This is not possible, if the environment is cleared before (with env -).
Why is it even cleared?
body:
Yes, my path is empty (I thought that is the purpose of "env -"). Python is installed into `/usr/bin/python`. Never the less, I don't want to build with my systems default python binary, but with the one inside my virtualenv. This is not possible, if the environment is cleared before (with `env -`).

Why is it even cleared?
